combatbonus.description: unarmed strikes or natural weapons count as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

checklist.name: Channel (Su)
checklist.description: You can unleash a wave of positive energy. You must choose to deal 9d6 points of positive energy damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures of 9d6 points of damage. Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a DC 20 Will save to halve the damage. You can use this ability 5 times per day.
checklist.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.40,48

item.name: Sihedron's Medallion (GM)
item.special_properties: While worn, a Sihedron medallion grants its wearer a +1 resistance bonus on all saving throws. Once per day, as a free action, it may be commanded to bestow the effects of false life on the wearer. Placed on the neck of a dead body, a Sihedron medallion preserves the body indefinitely via a gentle repose effect., Resistance bonus to all saving throws of +1
item.source: Personalizzato - Paizo Inc. - Core Rulebook

item.source: Personalizzato - Paizo Publishing LLC - Ultimate Equipment, p.252
item.quality: Aura: moderate necromancy [good], Caster Level: 10th, Construction Cost: 5,500 gp, Construction Requirements: Craft Wondrous Item, creator must be a 10th-level cleric, Slot: headband

item.name: Cooking Kit
item.special_properties: This kit contains an iron pot, an iron skillet, a ladle, a skewer, a wooden cutting board, a cutting knife, an iron tripod for the pot, a packet of tinder, and a small selection of local or otherwise easy to find seasonings. You can attach the skewer to the tripod for roasting small game animals. All the component pieces (except the skillet) fit within the pot for easy storage and transport.
item.source: Paizo Publishing LLC - Ultimate Equipment, p.62

item.source: Paizo Inc. - Core Rulebook, p.477
item.quality: Aura: faint conjuration (healing), Caster Level: 1st, Construction Cost: 25 gp, Construction Requirements: Brew Potion, cure light wounds, Slot: none

feat.name: Angelic Blood
feat.description: Your blood is infused with holy power.
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against effects with the evil descriptor and on Constitution checks to stabilize when you are reduced to negative hit points (but not dead). Furthermore, each time you take bleed or blood drain damage, each undead creature or creature with the evil subtype that is currently adjacent to you also takes 1 point of damage.
feat.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Race Guide, p.88

feat.name: Angelic Flesh
feat.description: Your skin shines like burnished metal.
feat.benefit: You take a -2 penalty on Disguise and Stealth checks but gain one of the following benefits, depending on the metallic affinity of your flesh (choose one).
feat.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Race Guide, p.88

feat.name: Angel Wings
feat.description: Feathered wings sprout from your back.
feat.benefit: You gain a pair of gleaming feathered wings that grant a fly speed of 30 feet (average maneuverability) if wearing light armor or unencumbered, or 20 feet (poor maneuverability) with a medium or heavy load or medium or heavy armor. Fly is a class skill for you.
feat.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Race Guide, p.87

feat.name: Armor Proficiency, Heavy
feat.description: You are skilled at wearing heavy armor.
feat.benefit: When you wear a type of armor with which you are proficient, the armor check penalty for that armor applies only to Dexterity- and Strength-based skill checks.

feat.name: Craft Magic Arms and Armor
feat.description: You can create magic armor, shields, or weapons.
feat.benefit: You can create magic weapons, armor, or shields. Enhancing a weapon, suit of armor, or shield takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in the price of its magical features. To enhance a weapon, suit of armor, or shield, you must use up raw materials costing half of this total price. See the magic item creation rules in Chapter 15 for more information. The weapon, armor, or shield to be enhanced must be a masterwork item that you provide. Its cost is not included in the above cost. You can also mend a broken magic weapon, suit of armor, or shield if it is one that you could make. Doing so costs half the raw materials and half the time it would take to craft that item in the first place.

feat.name: Improved Initiative
feat.description: Your quick reflexes allow you to react quickly to danger.
feat.benefit: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.

feat.name: Selective Channeling
feat.description: You can choose whom to affect when you channel energy.
feat.benefit: When you channel energy, you can choose 4 targets in the area. These targets are not affected by your channeled energy.

special_quality.name: Bonus Oracle Revelation Level (2x)
special_quality.description: Oracle: Add +1/2 to the oracle's level for the purpose of determining the effects of one revelation.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Race Guide, p.85

special_quality.name: Celestial Resistance (Ex)
special_quality.description: Aasimars have acid resistance 5, cold resistance 5, and electricity resistance 5.

special_quality.name: Combat Healer (Su)
special_quality.description: You cast cure spells as a swift action by expending two spell slots. This does not increase the level of the spell. You can use this ability 2 time(s) per day.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.49

special_quality.name: Energy Body (Su)
special_quality.description: As a standard action, you can transform your body into pure life energy, resembling a golden-white fire elemental. In this form, you gain the elemental subtype and give off a warm, welcoming light that increases the light level within 10 feet by one step, up to normal light. Any undead creature striking you with its body or a handheld weapon deals normal damage, but at the same time the attacker takes 1d6+13 points of positive energy damage. Creatures wielding melee weapons with reach are not subject to this damage if they attack you. If you grapple or attack an undead creature using unarmed strikes or natural weapons, you may deal this damage in place of the normal damage for the attack. Once per round, if you pass through a living allied creature's square or the ally passes through your square, it heals 1d6+13 hit points. You may use this ability to heal yourself as a move action. You choose whether or not to heal a creature when it passes through your space. You may return to your normal form as a free action. You may remain in energy body form for 13 rounds per day.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.49

special_quality.name: Haunted
special_quality.description: Malevolent spirits follow you wherever you go, causing minor mishaps and strange occurrences (such as unexpected breezes, small objects moving on their own, and faint noises).
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.44

special_quality.name: Healing Hands (Ex)
special_quality.description: You gain a +4 bonus on Heal checks. You may provide first aid to two people or treat two people for poison as a standard action (make a separate Heal check for each creature). When using the Heal skill to treat wounds from caltrops (and so on), treat deadly wounds, treat poison, treat disease, or treat long-term care, you may treat double the normal number of people you may treat at the same time. You may provide longterm care for yourself.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.49

special_quality.name: Life Mysteries
special_quality.description: You draw upon the divine mystery of Life to grant your spells and powers.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.48

special_quality.name: Orisons
special_quality.description: You can prepare a number of orisons, or 0-level spells. These spells are cast like any other spells, but they are not expended when used and may be used again.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.45

special_quality.name: Resistance to Acid (Ex)
special_quality.description: You may ignore 5 points of Acid damage each time you take acid damage.
special_quality.aspect: Ability Benefit: 5, Resistance: Acid, ResistanceOutput: Acid 5

special_quality.name: Resistance to Cold (Ex)
special_quality.description: You may ignore 5 points of Cold damage each time you take cold damage.
special_quality.aspect: Ability Benefit: 5, Resistance: Cold, ResistanceOutput: Cold 5

special_quality.name: Resistance to Electricity (Ex)
special_quality.description: You may ignore 5 points of Electricity damage each time you take electricity damage.
special_quality.aspect: Ability Benefit: 5, Resistance: Electricity, ResistanceOutput: Electricity 5

special_quality.name: Skilled (Ex)
special_quality.description: Garuda Blooded Aasimars receive a +2 bonus to Acrobatics and Fly checks.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Player Companion: Blood of Angels, p.7

special_quality.name: Spell-Like Ability (Sp)
special_quality.description: Garuda Blooded Aasimars can use see invisibility 1/day as a spell-like ability.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Player Companion: Blood of Angels, p.7

special_quality.name: Steel
special_quality.description: You take a -2 penalty on Disguise and Stealth checks but gain a +1 natural armor bonus to AC, and your unarmed strikes or natural weapons count as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
special_quality.aspect: CombatBonus: unarmed strikes or natural weapons count as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Race Guide, p.88

special_quality.name: +1 Skill Bonus (Appraise, Appraise, Knowledge (Local), Knowledge (Local), Spellcraft, Spellcraft, Survival)
special_quality.description: GM awarded PC with +1 skill bonus.

special_quality.name: Add Language (Elven)
special_quality.description: GM awarded PC with bonus Language.

special_attack.name: Channel (Su)
special_attack.description: You can unleash a wave of positive energy. You must choose to deal 9d6 points of positive energy damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures of 9d6 points of damage. Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a DC 20 Will save to halve the damage. You can use this ability 5 times per day.
special_attack.aspect: Ability Benefit: (9d6, DC 20, 5/day), CheckCount: 5, CheckType: Uses per day
special_attack.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.40,48

trait.name: Orphaned
trait.description: You grew up separated from your birth parents, and had to learn to watch out for yourself. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Survival checks, and Survival is always a class skill for you.

trait.name: Possessed
trait.description: You were, or are, possessed in some way by another entity that grants you occasional access to its knowledge. Once per day, you can attempt a Knowledge check of your choice even if you are not trained in that skill and it is not usually possible to use that skill untrained. If you can normally use that skill untrained, you gain a +2 trait bonus on the check.

character.weapon_proficiencies: Battle Aspergillum, Bayonet, Blowgun, Boar Spear, Boarding Pike, Brass Knife, Brass Knuckles, Cestus, Club, Heavy Crossbow, Light Crossbow, Dagger, Chain Dagger, Punching Dagger, Dart, Gaff, Gauntlet, Spiked Gauntlet, Grapple, Hair, Hanbo, Hook Hand, Javelin, Khakkhara, Kumade, Kunai, Longspear, Heavy Mace, Light Mace, Mere Club, Morningstar, Pliers, Quarterstaff, Rock, Shortspear, Sickle, Skull, Sling, Spear, Boar Spear, Ray Spells, Touch Spells, Splash Weapon, Stake, Stingchuck, Stonebow, Unarmed Strike, Underwater Heavy Crossbow, Underwater Light Crossbow, Weighted Spear

spell.name: See Invisibility
spell.effect: You can see any objects or beings that are invisible within your range of vision, as well as any that are ethereal, as if they were normally visible.
spell.description: You can see any objects or beings that are invisible within your range of vision, as well as any that are ethereal, as if they were normally visible.

spell.name: Bleed
spell.effect: You cause a living creature that is below 0 hit points but stabilized to resume dying.
spell.description: You cause a living creature that is below 0 hit points but stabilized to resume dying.

spell.name: Create Water
spell.effect: This spell generates wholesome, drinkable water, just like clean rain water.
spell.description: This spell generates wholesome, drinkable water, just like clean rain water.

spell.name: Detect Magic
spell.effect: You detect magical auras.
spell.description: You detect magical auras.

spell.name: Detect Poison
spell.effect: You determine whether a creature, object, or area has been poisoned or is poisonous.
spell.target: Or Area one creature, one object, or a 5-ft. cube
spell.description: You determine whether a creature, object, or area has been poisoned or is poisonous.

spell.name: Enhanced Diplomacy
spell.effect: You imbue the subject with divine diplomacy skills. The creature gets a +2 competence bonus on a single Diplomacy or Intimidate check. It must choose to use the bonus before making the roll to which it applies.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Companion: Taldor, Echoes of Glory, p.24

spell.description: You imbue the subject with divine diplomacy skills. The creature gets a +2 competence bonus on a single Diplomacy or Intimidate check. It must choose to use the bonus before making the roll to which it applies.

spell.name: Mending
spell.effect: This spell repairs damaged objects, restoring 1d4 hit points to the object.
spell.target: One object of up to 13 lb.
spell.description: This spell repairs damaged objects, restoring 1d4 hit points to the object.

spell.name: Read Magic
spell.effect: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.
spell.description: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.

spell.name: Scrivener's Chant
spell.effect: This spell imbues a quill with animate energy and rapidly transcribes words from one page to another. The quill copies a written work at the rate of one normal-sized page per minute. The Linguistics skill can be used to make a convincing copy, but otherwise the reproduction is written in the hand of the caster. You must concentrate upon the material being duplicated for the spell's duration and provide new blank pages as required. The scrivener's chant requires blank paper and a quill or other writing materials, in addition to the material components. This spell cannot duplicate magical writing [including spells and magical scrolls], though it can duplicate non-magical writing from a magical source.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Seekers of Secrets - A Guide to the Pathfinder Society, p.17

spell.description: This spell imbues a quill with animate energy and rapidly transcribes words from one page to another. The quill copies a written work at the rate of one normal-sized page per minute. The Linguistics skill can be used to make a convincing copy, but otherwise the reproduction is written in the hand of the caster. You must concentrate upon the material being duplicated for the spell's duration and provide new blank pages as required. The scrivener's chant requires blank paper and a quill or other writing materials, in addition to the material components. This spell cannot duplicate magical writing (including spells and magical scrolls), though it can duplicate non-magical writing from a magical source.

spell.name: Virtue
spell.effect: With a touch, you infuse a creature with a tiny surge of life, granting the subject 1 temporary hit point.
spell.description: With a touch, you infuse a creature with a tiny surge of life, granting the subject 1 temporary hit point.

spell.name: Mage Hand
spell.effect: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.
spell.target: One nonmagical, unattended object weighing up to 5 lbs.
spell.description: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.

spell.name: Ghost Sound
spell.effect: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.
spell.description: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.

spell.name: Cure Light Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 1d8+5 points of damage.
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 1d8+(min(5,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Divine Favor
spell.effect: Calling upon the strength and wisdom of a deity, you gain a +3 luck bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls.

source.source: Paizo Publishing LLC - Core Rulebook, p.273

spell.description: Calling upon the strength and wisdom of a deity, you gain a +(max(1,min(3,floor(CASTERLEVEL/3)))) luck bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls.

spell.name: Entropic Shield
spell.effect: A magical field appears around you, glowing with a chaotic blast of multicolored hues deflecting incoming arrows, rays, and other ranged attacks.
spell.description: A magical field appears around you, glowing with a chaotic blast of multicolored hues deflecting incoming arrows, rays, and other ranged attacks.

spell.name: Shield of Faith
spell.effect: This spell creates a shimmering, magical field around the target that averts and deflects attacks.

source.source: Paizo Publishing LLC - Core Rulebook, p.342

spell.description: This spell creates a shimmering, magical field around the target that averts and deflects attacks.

spell.name: Sun Metal
spell.effect: Target weapon ignites into flame that does not hurt the weapon or the wielder, but damages those hit by the weapon. Weapon touched bursts into flames.

source.source: Paizo Publishing LLC - Pathfinder Player Companion: Faiths of Purity, p.28

spell.description: Target weapon ignites into flame that does not hurt the weapon or the wielder, but damages those hit by the weapon. Weapon touched bursts into flames.

spell.name: Inflict Light Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 1d8+5 points of damage.
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 1d8+(min(5,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Detect Undead
spell.effect: You can detect the aura that surrounds undead creatures.
spell.description: You can detect the aura that surrounds undead creatures.

spell.name: Cure Moderate Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 2d8+10 points of damage.
spell.saveinfo: Will half (harmless) or Will half; see text
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 2d8+(min(10,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Ironskin
spell.effect: Your skin hardens and takes on the color and texture of rough iron. You gain a +4 enhancement bonus to your existing natural armor bonus [if you do not have a natural armor bonus, you are considered to have an effective natural armor bonus of +0]. This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every 4 caster levels above 3rd, to a maximum of +7 at 15th level. While you're under the effects of this spell, if an opponent confirms a critical hit or sneak attack against you with a physical weapon [not a spell or magical effect], you can dismiss this spell to negate the critical hit or sneak attack and treat it is as a normal hit. Dismissing the spell in this way is not an action, but you must be conscious and aware of the attack to do so.
spell.description: Your skin hardens and takes on the color and texture of rough iron. You gain a +4 enhancement bonus to your existing natural armor bonus (if you do not have a natural armor bonus, you are considered to have an effective natural armor bonus of +0). This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every 4 caster levels above 3rd, to a maximum of +7 at 15th level. While you're under the effects of this spell, if an opponent confirms a critical hit or sneak attack against you with a physical weapon (not a spell or magical effect), you can dismiss this spell to negate the critical hit or sneak attack and treat it is as a normal hit. Dismissing the spell in this way is not an action, but you must be conscious and aware of the attack to do so.

spell.name: Silence
spell.effect: Upon the casting of this spell, complete silence prevails in the affected area.
spell.target: 20-ft.-radius emanation centered on a creature, object, or point in space
spell.saveinfo: Will negates; see text or none (object)
spell.description: Upon the casting of this spell, complete silence prevails in the affected area.

spell.name: Summon Monster II
spell.effect: This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can summon one creature from the 2nd-level list or 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 1st-level list.
spell.description: This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can summon one creature from the 2nd-level list or 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 1st-level list.

spell.name: Weapon of Awe
spell.effect: Weapon gets +2 on damage rolls.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.256

spell.description: Weapon gets +2 on damage rolls.

spell.name: Inflict Moderate Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 2d8+10 points of damage.
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 2d8+(min(10,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Minor Image
spell.effect: This spell functions like silent image, except that minor image includes some minor sounds but not understandable speech.
spell.target: Visual figment that cannot extend beyond 17 10-ft. cubes [S]
spell.description: This spell functions like silent image, except that minor image includes some minor sounds but not understandable speech.

spell.name: Restoration (Lesser)
spell.effect: Lesser restoration dispels any magical effects reducing one of the subject's ability scores or cures 1d4 points of temporary ability damage to one of the subject's ability scores.
spell.description: Lesser restoration dispels any magical effects reducing one of the subject's ability scores or cures 1d4 points of temporary ability damage to one of the subject's ability scores.

spell.name: Levitate
spell.effect: Levitate allows you to move yourself, another creature, or an object up and down as you wish.
spell.target: You or one willing creature or one object [total weight up to 1300 lbs.]
spell.description: Levitate allows you to move yourself, another creature, or an object up and down as you wish.

spell.name: Archon's Aura
spell.effect: Aura penalizes enemy attacks and AC.
spell.description: Aura penalizes enemy attacks and AC.

spell.name: Cure Serious Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 3d8+13 points of damage.
spell.saveinfo: Will half (harmless) or Will half; see text
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 3d8+(min(15,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Stone Shape
spell.effect: You can form an existing piece of stone into any shape that suits your purpose.
spell.target: Stone or stone object touched, up to 23 cu. ft.

source.source: Paizo Publishing LLC - Core Rulebook, p.349

spell.description: You can form an existing piece of stone into any shape that suits your purpose.

spell.name: Trial by Fire
spell.effect: You test a creature's purity of convictions by exposing it to a sheet of divine fire. Unless the target's alignment is within one step of your deity's, the spell deals 5d6 points of damage. Half the damage is fire damage, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by resistance to fire-based attacks. Additionally, if the target has an element of its alignment that is in direct opposition to your deity's [chaos opposes law and evil opposes good], you can also attempt an Intimidate check to demoralize the target as a free action.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Player Companion: Spymaster's Handbook, p.22

spell.description: You test a creature's purity of convictions by exposing it to a sheet of divine fire. Unless the target's alignment is within one step of your deity's, the spell deals (min(5,CASTERLEVEL/2))d6 points of damage. Half the damage is fire damage, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by resistance to fire-based attacks. Additionally, if the target has an element of its alignment that is in direct opposition to your deity's (chaos opposes law and evil opposes good), you can also attempt an Intimidate check to demoralize the target as a free action.

spell.name: Neutralize Poison
spell.effect: You detoxify any sort of venom in the creature or object touched.
spell.target: Creature or object of up to 13 cu. ft. touched
spell.description: You detoxify any sort of venom in the creature or object touched.

spell.name: Inflict Serious Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 3d8+13 points of damage.
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 3d8+(min(15,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Aura of Doom
spell.effect: Creatures in your aura become shaken.
spell.description: Creatures in your aura become shaken.

spell.name: Bit of Luck
spell.effect: For the spell's duration, the caster gains a reservoir of luck with 6 points. During the spell's duration, the caster can spend 1 point from this reservoir when making an attack roll or skill check to add a +1d8 luck bonus to the d20 roll's result. This bonus can be added before or after the roll or check's result is revealed, and if this bonus is large enough to turn a failure into a success, the roll succeeds. The spell instantly ends when all points are expended or when it is cast on the target again. An 8th-level caster can instead spend 4 points to add a +2d8 luck bonus, and a 16th-level caster can spend 8 luck points to instead add a +3d8 luck bonus.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Player Companion: Blood of the Beast, p.7

spell.description: For the spell's duration, the caster gains a reservoir of luck with 6 points. During the spell's duration, the caster can spend 1 point from this reservoir when making an attack roll or skill check to add a +1d8 luck bonus to the d20 roll's result. This bonus can be added before or after the roll or check's result is revealed, and if this bonus is large enough to turn a failure into a success, the roll succeeds. The spell instantly ends when all points are expended or when it is cast on the target again. An 8th-level caster can instead spend 4 points to add a +2d8 luck bonus, and a 16th-level caster can spend 8 luck points to instead add a +3d8 luck bonus.

spell.name: Path of Glory (Greater)
spell.effect: Create an expanding glow that heals allies within it of 5 hp of damage.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.189

spell.description: Create an expanding glow that heals allies within it of 5 hp of damage.

spell.name: Summon Genie (Lesser)
spell.effect: This spell functions like a summon monster spell, except you can summon one janni.

source.source: Paizo Publishing - Pathfinder Player Companion: People of the Sands, p.11

spell.description: This spell functions like a summon monster spell, except you can summon one janni.

spell.name: Restoration
spell.effect: This spell functions like lesser restoration, except that it also dispels temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.
spell.description: This spell functions like lesser restoration, except that it also dispels temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.

spell.name: Inflict Critical Wounds
spell.effect: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 4d8+13 points of damage.
spell.description: When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals 4d8+(min(20,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage.

spell.name: Burst of Glory
spell.effect: Allies in the area of this spell at the time of casting gain a + 1 sacred bonus on attack rolls and saves against fear effects, plus 1 temporary hit point per caster level [maximum 20]. You shine with a white or golden radiance equal to a torch for the spell's duration, though you can dismiss the glow effect as a free action.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Inner Sea Gods, p.230

spell.description: Allies in the area of this spell at the time of casting gain a + 1 sacred bonus on attack rolls and saves against fear effects, plus 1 temporary hit point per caster level (maximum 20). You shine with a white or golden radiance equal to a torch for the spell's duration, though you can dismiss the glow effect as a free action.

spell.name: Flame Strike
spell.effect: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire dealing 13d6 points of damage.

source.source: Paizo Publishing LLC - Core Rulebook, p.283

spell.description: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire dealing (min(15,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of damage.

spell.name: Raise Dead
spell.effect: You restore life to a deceased creature.
spell.description: You restore life to a deceased creature.

spell.name: Breath of Life
spell.effect: This spell cures 5d8+13 points of damage
spell.saveinfo: Will negates (harmless) or Will half, see text
spell.description: This spell cures 5d8+(min(CASTERLEVEL,25)) points of damage

spell.name: Inflict Light Wounds (Mass)
spell.effect: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 1d8+13 points of damage to nearby living enemies.
spell.target: 13 creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
spell.description: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 1d8+(min(25,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage to nearby living enemies.

spell.name: Telekinesis
spell.duration: Concentration [up to 13 rounds] or instantaneous; see text
spell.effect: You move objects or creatures by concentrating on them.
spell.saveinfo: Will negates (object) or none; see text; Spell
spell.description: You move objects or creatures by concentrating on them.

spell.name: Elemental Assessor
spell.effect: A ray of spiraling colors springs from your hand and streaks to its target. You must make a successful ranged touch attack to hit your target with the ray, which deals 2d6 points of acid damage, 2d6 points of cold damage, 2d6 points of electricity damage, and 2d6 points of fire damage. The type of energy that does the most points of damage to the target then persists, dealing another 4d6 points of that type of damage per round for 1d4 rounds.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Chronicle of the Righteous, p.50

spell.description: A ray of spiraling colors springs from your hand and streaks to its target. You must make a successful ranged touch attack to hit your target with the ray, which deals 2d6 points of acid damage, 2d6 points of cold damage, 2d6 points of electricity damage, and 2d6 points of fire damage. The type of energy that does the most points of damage to the target then persists, dealing another 4d6 points of that type of damage per round for 1d4 rounds.

spell.name: Harm
spell.effect: Harm charges a subject with negative energy that deals 130 points of damage.
spell.description: Harm charges a subject with negative energy that deals (min(150,CASTERLEVEL*10)) points of damage.

spell.name: Sign of Wrath
spell.effect: A giant, glowing symbol of wrath appears below you, forcibly repulsing all nearby creatures. All creatures within the area of effect take 1d6 points of force damage per caster level [maximum 15d6] and are subjected to a bull rush that attempts to push them directly away from you. The blast's bull rush effect has a CMB bonus equal to your caster level + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier [whichever is highest]. You are unaffected by both the spell's damage and its bull rush effect, and may select up to one creature per 4 caster levels to also be ignored by the spells effects. Focus: a gem worth 1,000 gp inscribed with the Thassilonian symbol of wrath.

source.source: Paizo Publishing - Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path, p.419

spell.description: A giant, glowing symbol of wrath appears below you, forcibly repulsing all nearby creatures. All creatures within the area of effect take 1d6 points of force damage per caster level (maximum 15d6) and are subjected to a bull rush that attempts to push them directly away from you. The blast's bull rush effect has a CMB bonus equal to your caster level + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (whichever is highest). You are unaffected by both the spell's damage and its bull rush effect, and may select up to one creature per 4 caster levels to also be ignored by the spells effects. Focus: a gem worth 1,000 gp inscribed with the Thassilonian symbol of wrath.

spell.name: Wind Walk
spell.effect: You alter the substance of your body to a cloudlike vapor and move through the air, possibly at great speed.
spell.description: You alter the substance of your body to a cloudlike vapor and move through the air, possibly at great speed.

spell.name: Inflict Moderate Wounds (Mass)
spell.effect: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 2d8+13 points of damage to nearby living enemies.
spell.target: 13 creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
spell.description: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 2d8+(min(30,CASTERLEVEL)) points of damage to nearby living enemies.

spell.name: Heal
spell.effect: Heal enables you to channel positive energy into a creature to wipe away injury and afflictions.
spell.description: Heal enables you to channel positive energy into a creature to wipe away injury and afflictions.

spell.name: See Invisibility
spell.effect: You can see any objects or beings that are invisible within your range of vision, as well as any that are ethereal, as if they were normally visible.
spell.description: You can see any objects or beings that are invisible within your range of vision, as well as any that are ethereal, as if they were normally visible.
